problem.markdown:
1. The execution of a loop typically starts with: (x) initialization statements ( ) Loop body ( ) test condition ( ) update statements
2. The break statement is used to exit from: ( ) an if statement (x) a for loop ( ) a program ( ) the main( ) function
3. A do-while loop is useful when we want that the statements within the loop must be executed ( ) Only once (x) At Least Once ( ) More than once ( ) None of the above
4. In what sequence the initialization, testing and execution of body is done in a do-while loop (x) Initialization, execution of body, testing ( ) Execution of body, initialization, testing ( ) Initialization, testing, execution of body ( ) None of the above
5. Which of the following statement is used to take the control to the beginning of the loop? ( ) exit ( ) break (x) continue ( ) one of the above
6. Multiple intialization is not possible in for loop ( ) True (x) False
7. For loop can be converted into equivalent while loop (x) True ( ) False
8. Loop can not be nested ( ) True (x) False
9. When break is encountered inside any loop, control automatically passes to the beginning of the loop. ( ) True (x) False
10. Which of the following is not a loop in C (x) Repeat ( ) Do while ( ) While ( ) For
11. Which of the following is an exit controlled loop: ( ) For ( ) While (x) Do-While ( ) None of the above
12. Which among the following is an unconditional control structure: (x) goto ( ) break ( ) continue ( ) if else
